messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Book title and author for parselmouth
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 27/04/2003 18:57:06 Pacific Daylight Time, ... The author talks about her own childhood, and the traumas she faced. Then she talks about her
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 27/04/2003 18:57:06 Pacific Daylight Time,
starsuncloud@... writes:


> At Unity there is a lot of talk about everything being part of the whole,
> the
> God in all of us and so on...so maybe it won't be too "out there" for me? I
>
> like hearing about new ideas either way.
>

The author talks about her own childhood, and the traumas she faced. Then she
talks about her spiritual awakening and awareness of the spirituality of all
life on earth. Not my usual stuff, but it really spoke to me. I have a thing
going on with my horse, and with dogs in general. I think from the sounds of
it you may like it. It is not so well written, but is interesting.
Nancy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Book title and author for parselmouth
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/27/03 4:22:18 AM Central Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/27/03 4:22:18 AM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< "Behaving As If The God In All Life Mattered", by MacHaelle Small Wright
I found it on Amazon. IT is a little "out there" for some folks, >>

Thanks.
I'll check into it. I hear about how "out there" I am from my co-workers all
the time...so I guess another strangeness won't much matter.
At Unity there is a lot of talk about everything being part of the whole, the
God in all of us and so on...so maybe it won't be too "out there" for me? I
like hearing about new ideas either way.

Ren
"They dined on mince, and slices of quince, Which they ate with a runcible
spoon;
And hand in hand, on the edge of the sand, they danced by the light of the
moon."
--The Owl and the Pussycat
Edward Lear
